entry.title: TDD - Triggering Dopamine Development
entry.summary: The other morning I attended an excellent talk by Andrew Richardson on the importance of having small goals. One of the points Andrew made was that completing a task, however small, triggers a hit of Dopamine - the neurotransmitter associated with feelings of pleasure and satisfaction. The way Andrew described the feedback loop involved reminded me of Test-Driven Development (TDD). This got me thinking - maybe this is why I like it so much?

entry.title: Team Topologies Applied
entry.summary: Team size and structure is a common topic of discussion in software engineering at scale, and while the "2 Pizza" team concept popularized by Amazon can be a helpful starting point, it may not be enough. When pizzas are being delivered by the truckload, a different set of tools and strategies is required to manage the complexity and ensure successful outcomes.
